Condition types are defined or displayed via the view cluster
maintenance /GICOM/VC_CNDTYP. There, the multilingual titles are
directly allocated to the condition types.
Maintenance view /GICOM/VC_CNDTYP
In order to guarantee the highest flexibility in the creation of a
condition, Release 8.0 enables the definition of many different factors
directly in the condition maintenance.
&PRECONDITIONS&
&STANDARD_SETUP&
&ACTIVITY&
A new condition type is created via the button "New Entry". Here,
several parameters must be entered for the determination of the
condition type. By marking a row in the condition type overview, the
marked condition type will be used as a template for further condition
types.
Below the maintainable fields are illustrated:
Ø,,Condition type: Enter an alphanumerical key for the condition type.
Ø,,Title condition type: The name of the condition type can be
maintained in the column below the definition of the condition types.
They can be maintained in different languages and will be displayed in
the chosen one.
Ø,,Validity of a condition type: The Valid from date controls the date
from which the condition type can be used. The Valid to corresponds to
the length of period during which the condition type is used. (Preset as
Ø,,Condition class: Via the condition class a condition is classified.
Here you define discounts or surcharges, prices, expense reimbursements,
taxes or extra payments.
Ø,,Calculation type: Indicates the unit of the condition type.
Percentage conditions are identified with the condition unit
“Percentage”. Conditions with a fixed amount (fixed amount conditions)
are identified with the
Ø,,condition unit “Fixed amount”. Further, the unit "Quantity “can be
selected. If this is selected, alternative quantity units can be
determined in the condition maintenance of the AD itself.
Ø,,Discounts / Prepayments allowed: A Checkbox which controls whether
the maintenance of a discount or an advance payment is allowed for the
implementation of the condition type.
Ø,,Scale allowed: Checkbox which controls whether the maintenance of a
scale is allowed for the implementation of the condition type.
Ø,,Scale type: Determines the type of scale. A distinction is made
between from-scale and to-scale. You can also select "maintainable in
condition record". If this feature is selected, the scale type is
determined in the condition maintenance of the AD itself.
Ø,,Scale base: Determines what the entered scale relates on. A
distinction is made between a Value scale and a Quantity scale.
Ø,,Cap claim minimum condition type: The value which is entered here is
the smallest value which can be entered in the agreement maintenance. If
you enter a value, you will get a warning if you want to maintain an
agreement with smaller value.
Ø,,Cap claim maximum condition type: The value which is entered here is
the highest value which can be entered in the agreement maintenance. If
you enter a value, you will get a warning if you want to maintain an
agreement with higher value.
Ø,,Verbal condition allowed: Defines whether the condition can be used
as a verbal condition.
Ø,,Condition contract type: The CCS condition contract type, to which
the condition will be mapped.
Ø,,Application: Application for which the condition contract will be
defined. It can either be M for the purchasing side or V for the sales
side.
Ø,,Condition type SAP: SAP condition type to which the gicom condition
type will be mapped.
